title: States the maximum rate of interest on credit cards shall not exceed eighteen percent annually
summary: Authorizes the banking board to set the maximum rate of interest for credit cards at not to exceed 18% annually; such rate may only exceed 18% if the prime rate exceeds 18% for sixty consecutive days, but in no event shall such new rate be more than one and one quarter percent above the prime rate in effect at the time such rate is set.
actClause: AN ACT to amend the banking law, in relation to the maximum rate of interest on credit cards
